item.title: VR headset prices high as Apple bides its time
item.description: New devices from Meta and HTC cost more than £1,000, but all eyes are on rumoured Apple glasses.

item.title: Winklevoss firm charged in US over crypto sales
item.description: Its partner company is also accused of illegal sales to hundreds of thousands of investors.

item.title: Tesla cuts prices by up to a fifth to boost demand
item.description: The electric car maker is reducing prices by thousands of pounds as global downturn threatens sales.

item.title: Smart appliances could stop working after two years, says Which?
item.description: The consumer champion found "hardly any" brands came close to matching a device's expected lifespan.

item.title: Royal Mail hit by Russia-linked ransomware attack
item.description: The group is working "around the clock" to resolve severe disruption to overseas deliveries.

item.title: Apple boss Tim Cook to have pay cut by over 40% this year
item.description: The technology giant's chief executive Tim Cook has faced criticism from investors.

item.title: Online Safety Bill changes 'not ruled out' - culture secretary
item.description: Tory rebels want to make social media bosses criminally liable if they fail to protect children.

item.title: Twitter says leaked emails not hacked from its systems
item.description: But it warns users to beware of criminals using the data to send fraudulent messages.

item.title: Rishi Sunak facing major Tory rebellion over internet safety law
item.description: Nearly 40 Tory MPs want tech bosses to face time in prison if they fail to protect children online.

item.title: FTX: Collapsed crypto giant recovers over $5bn of assets
item.description: The firm's former chief executive Sam Bankman-Fried is accused of orchestrating an "epic" fraud.

item.title: UK Twitter employees in legal threat over redundancies
item.description: A legal letter seen by BBC News calls workers' treatment "unlawful, unfair and completely unacceptable".

item.title: UK investor reported losing £1m in FTX collapse
item.description: Twelve others also reported losses in the failed exchange to a City of London Police scam hotline in November.

item.title: UK Treasury considers plan for digital pound
item.description: The economic secretary to the Treasury says the UK is committed to becoming a world crypto hub.

item.title: iPhone designer Sir Jony Ive pays tribute to Tom Karen
item.description: Sir Jony Ive said the late designer "perfectly embodied the ideals and values of a generation".

item.title: Meta denies African content-moderator firm exit poses risk
item.description: Sama, which runs Facebook's moderation hub for east Africa, is to stop providing content-review services.

item.title: Why it is becoming easier to sue Big Tech in the UK
item.description: The amount of damages being sought in class actions leapt from £4bn in 2021 to £26bn in 2022.

item.title: Almost 90% of games sold in UK in 2022 were digital - ERA
item.description: Physical game sales fell 4.5% last year, the digital entertainment and retail association says.

item.title: YouTube star Logan Paul apologises for CryptoZoo project failure
item.description: The YouTuber says he plans to "make this right" after fans lost money investing in his CryptoZoo game.

item.title: Iran protests: Facebook wrong to remove 'death to Khamenei' posts, board finds
item.description: Use of the slogan "death to Khamenei" in Persian did not break guidelines, a review finds.

item.title: Ukraine war: Trying to run start-ups in a conflict
item.description: A group of entrepreneurs speak to the BBC about the challenges of running start-ups during a war.

item.title: Wikipedia operator denies Saudi infiltration claim
item.description: Two human rights groups accused Riyadh of using agents to "promote positive content" on the site.

item.title: US bank Silvergate hit with $8bn in crypto withdrawals
item.description: The bank has had to sell $5.2bn in assets to cover two-thirds of its customers withdrawing their deposits.

item.title: WhatsApp to enable messaging in internet blackouts
item.description: Instant-messaging service WhatsApp is letting users connect via proxy servers so they can stay online.

item.title: Many Android phones to get satellite connectivity
item.description: When there is no mobile coverage, phones will be able to send emergency texts via satellite.

item.title: Schools hit by cyber attack and documents leaked
item.description: Confidential details including child passport scans and SEN data is published online, the BBC finds.

item.title: Samsung profits plunge as demand for gadgets slows
item.description: The global economic slowdown is impacting memory chip prices and demand for devices.

item.title: How drones could be the future of Indian farming
item.description: Companies in India are encouraging farmers to switch to drones - but is that working?

item.title: Using artificial intelligence to spot breast cancer
item.description: An Indian company has developed a cheaper, non-invasive test for breast cancer that uses thermal imaging and AI.

item.title: RLSS drone trial to help sea swimmers in trouble
item.description: The Royal Life Saving Society is trialling the use of buoyancy-aid-deploying drones.

item.title: Watch parties get a privacy focus with BBC trial
item.description: Individual users will be able to decide how much personal data they want to share with the service.

item.title: Ros Atkins On… Elon Musk and Twitter
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at the twists and turns of Elon Musk’s early days in charge of the social media platform.

item.title: Lucky Girl Syndrome: Smug TikTok trend or life-changing positivity?
item.description: Lucky Girl Syndrome promotes positive thinking, manifesting good vibes and is spreading online.

item.title: India targets China's dominance in mobile phones
item.description: There's some way to go, but India hopes to build its own world-class mobile phone industry.

item.title: Gadgets unveiled at CES but Russia is banned
item.description: Thousands have come to Las Vegas for one of the world's largest technology shows.

item.title: Could floating solar farms survive out at sea?
item.description: Engineers are working on building solar farms robust enough to survive in the open ocean.

item.title: Ukraine war: What does facial recognition software make of Putin’s backdrop crowd?
item.description: There's been speculation public meetings with President Putin have been staged.

item.title: Flying boats and other tech for cleaner shipping
item.description: The shipping industry is experimenting with foils, sails and fuel to make itself less carbon intensive.

item.title: Tech trends 2023: Flying taxis and satellite phones
item.description: From the latest in electric aircraft to the satellites that connect to phones, next year's emerging tech.

item.title: The cargo hauling aircraft with no pilots on board
item.description: Rejecting deliveries to the doorstep, some drone makers are betting on bigger pilot-free aircraft.
